title:
Insights into regularity of 2D 3d transition metal monocarbides
  formation
abstract:
Recently several theoretical predictions were made about 2D planar FeC, CoC,
NiC, and CuC while their bulk phases still remain unknown. Here, we present
generalization of 2D family of 3d transition metal monocarbides (TMC) by
searching their stable configurations with DFT methods and evolutionary
algorithm. It is found that in the TMC row (TM = Sc-Cu) a tendency of 3D
rocksalt phase formation is monotonously interchanging by 2D phase appearance,
namely planar orthorhombic TMC characterized by carbon dimers inside metal
hexagons. Among them, orthorhombic CoC and FeC monocarbides would be likely
formed rather than any other 2D metal carbide phase or metal/graphene
interface.
